content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm looking to get the best possible price for my property. I believe the market rate for a 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in this location is around 800-900 euros per month. However, I'm willing to negotiate and consider offers that are slightly lower. What's your thoughts on that price range?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That's a very reasonable price, Herr Schmidt. However, as a student, I'm on a tight budget. I believe 650 euros per month would be a more suitable price for me.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hmm, 650 euros is a bit lower than what I had in mind, Max. However, I understand that students often have limited budgets, and I want to make sure that my apartment is affordable for everyone. Tell you what, I'll meet you halfway. How about we say 725 euros per month? That way, we can both feel good about the deal. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That's a generous offer, Herr Schmidt. I appreciate it. However, 725 euros is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay 700 euros per month.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
Max, you're a tough negotiator, I like that. Alright, 700 euros it is. But let me tell you, this is a steal. You're getting a fantastic apartment in a great location for a bargain price. You won't find a better deal anywhere else, I promise you that.

Now, let's get down to business. I'll need you to sign a lease agreement, and we'll need to discuss the terms of the rental. Utilities are included in the price, but you'll need to pay for your own internet and cable. The apartment is unfurnished, so you'll need to bring your own furniture and appliances. And of course, you'll need to take care of your own cleaning and maintenance.

But don't worry, I'm not going to nickel and dime you. I'm a fair landlord, and I want to make sure you're happy and comfortable in your new home. So, what do you say? Are you ready to sign the lease and move in?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I appreciate your flexibility, Herr Schmidt. However, 700 euros is the maximum I can pay. I don't want to continue the negotiation, because we have reached a price that I can afford. I agree to the price of 700 euros Euro!
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
TERMINATE.

Congratulations, Max! You've got yourself a great deal on a fantastic apartment. I'm glad we could come to an agreement that works for both of us.

Just one more thing before we proceed: I'll need you to provide a security deposit of 1,400 euros. This is a standard practice for any rental property, and it will be returned to you in full when you move out, provided there's no damage to the apartment.

Can you provide the security deposit today? If not, we can discuss alternative arrangements.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
